mgci.jhdap.shogi

Class BoardPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mgci.jhdap.shogi.BoardPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BoardPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The JPanel for the shogi board. Handles all of the drawing and sound. Updates based on invocations of its moveMouse (Point), pressMouse (int, Point), and releaseMouse (int) methods.
    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Dmitry Andreevich Paramonov
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Recalculates the drop table offsets based on the board offset, tile size, and drop table size.
      protected void recalculatePieceOffset()
      Recalculates the piece offset so that whenever a piece is drawn, it will always be centered on the shogi square.

      Updates the mousePressed boolean array.

      Resets the board to its default configuration.

      • mousePressed

        protected boolean[] mousePressed
        Whether the mouse button is currently being pressed or not.

      • proMode

        public boolean proMode
        If true, pro_mode mode is active. If active, all of the possible moves of a piece are not displayed when the piece is selected, and a player receives an instant loss if an invalid move is attempted.

      • showBoardLabels

        public boolean showBoardLabels
        If true, this panel draws the board coordinate labels (e.g. 1a, 2a, 2b).

      • showLastMove

        public boolean showLastMove
        If true, the previous move is indicated.

      • log

        public boolean log
        If true, the console (if open) logs every single little action

      • takeTurns

        public boolean takeTurns
        If true, the players take turns.

        The selected piece.

      • lastMoved

        protected Tile lastMoved
        The location of the last move.

      • turn

        protected int turn
        The current player.

      • winner

        protected int winner
        The winner of the game. 1 indicates the bottom player as winner. -1 indicates top player as winner. 0 indicates no winner;

      • pieceToDropTable

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Point> pieceToDropTable
        The relationship between shogi pieces and their positioning on the drop table, with (0,0) being at the top left of the drop table.

        public java.lang.String texturePath
        The name of the folder of the active texture pack. All texture packs are accessed from the texturepacks/ folder.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws everything on the BoardPanel in the following order:
        • The board, including tiles and pieces.
        • The board labels. (e.g. 1b, 5i)
        • The drop tables.
        • The tile highlights. This includes all possible moves for the piece if a piece is selected, and the tile the mouse is hovering over if a piece is not selected.
        • The pieces on the drop tables.
        • The selected piece.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawBoard

        protected void drawBoard(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all of the shogi board tiles and all of the pieces on the shogi board. Does not draw a piece if it is currently being selected because in this case, it would not be technically "on" the board. Also draws the lastMoved tile, if showLastMove is enabled.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawBoardLabels

        protected void drawBoardLabels(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the board coordinate labels (e.g. 1a, 2a, 2b), if showBoardLabels is enabled.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawHighlights

        protected void drawHighlights(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Redraws a highlighted shogi board tile on top of a normal shogi tile based on the state and positioning of the mouse. Highlights a tile if (1) the mouse is hovering over the tile, (2) the tile is not empty, (3) the mouse is not being pressed, and (4) it is legal for the current player to move the piece on that tile. Highlights all possible moves for a selected piece if (1) the mouse is being pressed, and (2) a piece is selected.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawHighlightedTile

        protected void drawHighlightedTile(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       java.awt.Point p)
        Draws a highlighted shogi board tile at the indicated location, with the default dimensions given by the tileSize variable.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        p - the x,y coordinates at which to draw

      • drawHighlightedTile

                       java.awt.Point p,
                       int width,
                       int height)
        Draws a highlighted shogi board tile at the indicated location, with the given dimensions.
        Parameters:

        p - the x,y coordinates at which to draw
        width - the width of the tile
        height - the height of the tile

      • getDropTablePieceAt

        protected Piece getDropTablePieceAt(int table,
                        java.awt.Point sq)
        Returns the last occurring piece that matches the type of piece that is located at the indicated coordinates of the indicated drop table allegiance. An allegiance of 1 indicates the bottom table; -1 indicates the top table.
        Parameters:
        table - the allegiance of the drop table
        sq - the location on the drop table
        Returns:
        the matching piece in the drop table ; null if no match

      • getDropTablePieceAt

        protected Piece getDropTablePieceAt(int table,
                        java.lang.String name)
        Finds and returns the last piece on the indicated drop table that matches the given name. Returns null if no match is found. (An allegiance of 1 indicates the bottom table; -1 indicates the top table.)
        Parameters:
        table - the allegiance of the drop table
        name - the name of the piece
        Returns:
        the matching piece in the drop table ; null if no match

      • drawPossibleMoves

        protected void drawPossibleMoves(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     Piece piece)
        If proMode is disabled, this method redraws all of the shogi board tiles to which it is legally valid for the given piece to move. Redraws these tiles as a highlighted tiles. Then redraws the shogi pieces on these tiles.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        piece - the shogi piece

      • drawDropTables

        protected void drawDropTables(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws both drop tables.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawDropTable

        protected void drawDropTable(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 int allegiance)
        Draws the drop table of the indicated allegiance. An allegiance of 1 indicates the bottom player; -1 indicates the top player.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        allegiance - the allegiance of the drop table to draw

      • drawDropTablePieces

        protected void drawDropTablePieces(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all of the pieces in both drop tables.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • drawDropTablePieces

        protected void drawDropTablePieces(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       int allegiance)
        Draws all of the pieces on the drop table of the given allegiance. An allegiance of 1 indicates the bottom table; -1 indicates the top table. The drop table is subdivided into the following arrangement, with (0,0) being at the top left:
        • Pawns at (0,0) and (1,0)
        • Lances at (0,1)
        • Knights at (1,1)
        • Silver Generals at (0,2)
        • Gold Generals at (1,2)
        • Bishops at (0,3)
        • Rooks at (1,3)
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        allegiance - the allegiance of the drop table

      • drawTile

        protected void drawTile(java.awt.Graphics g,
            java.awt.Point p)
        Draws a shogi board tile at the indicated location. Uses the default dimensions given by the tileSize variable.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        p - x,y coordinates at which to draw

      • drawPiece

        protected void drawPiece(java.awt.Graphics g,
             Piece p,
             java.awt.Point point)
        Draws the given shogi piece at the indicated location. This method adds the pieceOffset to the given coordinates in order to ensure that to piece remains centered on the shogi tiles.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint
        p - the piece
        point - the x,y coordinates at which to draw

      • getLocationOnBoard

        protected Tile getLocationOnBoard(java.awt.Point location)
        Converts the x,y coordinates of a point on the panel to the GameState file,rank coordinates of a tile on the shogi board. If the point is on a drop table, this method returns the point -1,-1. If the point is on neither the board nor any drop table, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        location - the x,y coordinates of the point to be converted
        Returns:
        the file,rank coordinates of the square.

      • getBoardLocationOnPanel

        protected java.awt.Point getBoardLocationOnPanel(int x,
                                     int y)
        Converts the GameState file,rank coordinates of a tile on the shogi board to x,y coordinates of a point on the Panel.
        Parameters:
        x - GameState file coordinate of tile
        y - GameState rank coordinate of tile
        Returns:
        the x,y coordinates of the tile relative to the source component

      • getBoardLocationOnPanel

        protected java.awt.Point getBoardLocationOnPanel(Tile sq)
        Converts the GameState file,rank coordinates of a tile on the shogi board to x,y coordinates of a point on the Panel.
        Parameters:
        sq - the file,rank coordinates of the tile to be converted
        Returns:
        the x,y coordinates of the tile relative to the source component

      • getDropTableLocationOnPanel

        protected java.awt.Point getDropTableLocationOnPanel(int allegiance,
                                         java.awt.Point sq)
        Converts the position coordinates of a zone on the indicated drop table to x,y coordinates of a point on the Panel.
        Parameters:
        allegiance - the allegiance of the drop table
        sq - the drop table position coordinates to be converted
        Returns:
        the x,y coordinates of the zone relative to the source component

      • getLocationOnDropTable

        protected java.awt.Point getLocationOnDropTable(int allegiance,
                                    java.awt.Point location)
        Converts the x,y coordinates of a point on the panel to position coordinates of a zone on the indicated drop table. Returns null if the point is not on the indicated drop table.
        Parameters:
        allegiance - the allegiance of the drop table
        location - the x,y coordinates of the point to be converted
        Returns:
        the position coordinates of a zone on the drop table

      • getImageHash

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImageHash(java.lang.String id)
        Finds the BufferedImage in the imageHash that matches the given identifier. If no match is found, this method returns null, and automatically prints a log message in the debug console, if logging is enabled.
        Parameters:
        id - the image identifier
        Returns:
        the matching BufferedImage

      • mouseIsOnBoard

        protected boolean mouseIsOnBoard()
        Checks if the mouse is currently hovering over the shogi board.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is on the board; false otherwise

      • mouseIsOnDropTable

        protected boolean mouseIsOnDropTable()
        Checks if the mouse is hovering over any drop table.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is on a drop table; false otherwise

      • mouseIsOnDropTable

        protected boolean mouseIsOnDropTable(int allegiance)
        Checks if the mouse is hovering over a drop table of the indicated allegiance. An allegiance of 1 means the bottom player; -1 means the top player.
        Parameters:
        allegiance - The allegiance of the drop table.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is on the indicated drop table; false otherwise

      • moveMouse

        protected void moveMouse(java.awt.Point location)
        Updates the cursor's current location on the panel.
        Parameters:
        location - the x,y coordinates of the cursor

      • pressMouse

        protected void pressMouse(int button,
              java.awt.Point location)
        Updates the mousePressed boolean array.
        Parameters:
        button - the button that was pressed
        location - the x,y coordinates of the cursor when the button was pressed

      • releaseMouse

        protected void releaseMouse(int button)
        Updates the mousePressed boolean array.
        Parameters:
        button - the button that was released

      • move

        public boolean move(Piece piece,
           Tile sq)
        Moves the indicated piece to the indicated square on the board if it is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to be moved
        sq - the file,rank coordinates of the new square

      • promote

        protected boolean promote(Piece piece)
        Promotes the given piece, if doing so is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to be promoted

      • getBoardOffset

        public java.awt.Point getBoardOffset()
        Gets the boardOffset field.
        Returns:
        the board offset

      • getDropTableSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getDropTableSize()
        Gets the dropTableSize field.
        Returns:
        the drop table dimensions

      • getPieceOffset

        public java.awt.Point getPieceOffset()
        Gets the pieceOffset field.
        Returns:
        the piece offset

      • getPieceSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPieceSize()
        Gets the pieceSize field.
        Returns:
        the piece dimensions

      • getTileSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getTileSize()
        Gets the tileSize field.
        Returns:
        the tile dimensions

      • setBoardOffset

        public void setBoardOffset(int x,
                  int y)
        Sets the board offset to the given x,y coordinates. Recalculates the drop table offsets accordingly.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of new board offset
        y - y coordinate of new board offset

      • setDropTableSize

        public void setDropTableSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the size of the drop tables to the given dimensions. Recalculates the drop table offsets accordingly.
        Parameters:
        width - new width of drop table
        height - new height of drop table

      • setPieceSize

        public void setPieceSize(int width,
                int height)
        Sets the size of a shogi piece to the given dimensions. Recalculates the piece offset accordingly.
        Parameters:
        width - new width of shogi piece
        height - new height of shogi piece

      • setTileSize

        public void setTileSize(int width,
               int height)
        Sets the size of squares on the shogi board to the given dimensions. Recalculates the drop table and piece offsets accordingly.
        Parameters:
        width - new width of shogi square
        height - new height of shogi square

      • recalculateDropTableOffsets

        protected void recalculateDropTableOffsets()
        Recalculates the drop table offsets based on the board offset, tile size, and drop table size. Ensures that the top drop table meets the top edge of the board, the bottom drop table meets the bottom edge of the board, and both drop tables meet the right edge of the board.

      • recalculatePieceOffset

        protected void recalculatePieceOffset()
        Recalculates the piece offset so that whenever a piece is drawn, it will always be centered on the shogi square.

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Resets the board to its default configuration.

      • loadImages

        public void loadImages()
        Loads all of the images from the indicated texture pack path into the local HashMap imageHash field. Initializes the dropTableSize, tileSize, and pieceSize fields based on the sizes of the loaded images.

      • readImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage readImage(java.lang.String imageName)
        Loads the image with the indicated imageName at the location indicated by the texturePath field. If no such file is found, if logging is enabled, this message prints an error message in the console.
        Parameters:
        imageName - the name of the image, including file extension
        Returns:
        the loaded BufferedImage
